form.official-title: To require foreign manufacturers of products imported into the United States to establish registered agents in the United States who are authorized to accept service of process against such manufacturers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Foreign Manufacturers Legal Accountability Act of 2010.

paragraph.text: The term applicable agency means, with respect to covered products—

subparagraph.text: described in paragraph (3)(C), the Consumer Product Safety Commission;
described in paragraph (3)(F), the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration; and
described in paragraph (3)(G)—

clause.text: the Environmental Protection Agency, if the item is intended to be a component part of a product described in subparagraphs (D) or (E) of paragraph (3); and
the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, if the item is intended to be a component part of a product described in paragraph (3)(F).

paragraph.text: The term commerce means trade, traffic, commerce, or transportation—

subparagraph.text: between a place in a State and any place outside thereof; or
which affects trade, traffic, commerce, or transportation described in subparagraph (A).

paragraph.text: The term covered product means any of the following:

subparagraph.text: Drugs, devices, and cosmetics, as such terms are defined in section 201 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 321).
A biological product, as such term is defined in section 351(i) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 262(i)).
A consumer product, as such term is used in section 3(a) of the Consumer Product Safety Act (15 U.S.C. 2052).
A chemical substance or new chemical substance, as such terms are defined in section 3 of the Toxic Substances Control Act (15 U.S.C. 2602).
A pesticide, as such term is defined in section 2 of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (7 U.S.C. 136).
A motor vehicle or motor vehicle equipment, as such terms are defined in section 30102 of title 49, United States Code.
An item intended to be a component part of a product described in subparagraph (A), (B), (C), (D), (E), or (F) but is not yet a component part of such product.

paragraph.text: The term distribute in commerce means to sell in commerce, to introduce or deliver for introduction into commerce, or to hold for sale or distribution after introduction into commerce.
The term foreign manufacturer or producer does not include—

subparagraph.text: a foreign manufacturer or producer of covered products that is owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by one or more United States natural or legal persons, if—

clause.text: the United States natural or legal person has assets in excess of the foreign manufacturer or producer; or

the United States natural or legal person owns or controls more than one foreign manufacturer or producer of covered products and such person has assets in excess of the average assets held by each foreign manufacturer or producer; or

subparagraph.text: a foreign manufacturer or producer of covered products that owns or controls, or through common ownership or control is affiliated with, directly or indirectly, one or more United States operating legal persons if the principal executive officer residing in the United States of each United States operating legal person certifies in writing to the applicable agency that such person—

clause.text: is responsible for any liability from a covered product of the foreign manufacturer or producer, including liability from the design, testing, assembly, manufacturing, warnings, labeling, inspection, packaging, or any other cause of action related to the covered product; and
will serve as the initial point of contact for the applicable agency in case of a voluntary or mandatory recall or other issue involving the safety of a covered product.

section.header: Registration of agents of foreign manufacturers authorized to accept service of process in the United States

paragraph.text: Beginning on the date that is 180 days after the date on which the regulations are prescribed pursuant to section 3(d) and except as provided in this subsection, the head of each applicable agency shall require foreign manufacturers and producers of covered products distributed in commerce to register an agent in the United States who is authorized to accept service of process on behalf of such manufacturer or producer for the purpose of any State or Federal regulatory proceeding or any civil action in State or Federal court related to such covered product, if such service is made in accordance with the State or Federal rules for service of process in the State in which the case or regulatory action is brought.
The head of each applicable agency shall require that an agent of a foreign manufacturer or producer registered under paragraph (1) be—

subparagraph.text: located in a State chosen by the foreign manufacturer or producer with a substantial connection to the importation, distribution, or sale of the products of the foreign manufacturer or producer; and
an individual, domestic firm, or domestic corporation that is a permanent resident of the United States.

paragraph.header: Designation by manufacturer or producer and acceptance by agent
paragraph.text: The head of each applicable agency shall, at a minimum, require a—

subparagraph.text: written designation by a foreign manufacturer or producer with respect to which paragraph (1) applies—

clause.text: containing the full legal name, principal place of business, and mailing address of the manufacturer or producer; and
containing a statement that the designation is valid and binding on the foreign manufacturer or producer for the purposes of this Act.

subparagraph.text: written acceptance by the agent registered by a foreign manufacturer or producer with respect to which paragraph (1) applies—

clause.text: signed by the agent or, in the case in which a domestic firm or domestic corporation is designated as an agent, an official or employee of the firm or corporation with authority to sign for the firm or corporation;
containing the agent’s full legal name, physical address, mailing address, and phone number; and

containing a statement that the agent accepts the designation and acknowledges that the duties of the agent may not be assigned to another person or entity and the duties remain in effect until withdrawn or replaced by the foreign manufacturer or producer.

subparagraph.text: Paragraph (1) applies only with respect to a foreign manufacturer or producer that exceeds minimum requirements established by the head of the applicable agency under this section.
In determining the minimum requirements for application of paragraph (1) to a foreign manufacturer or producer, the head of the applicable agency shall, at a minimum, consider the following:

clause.text: The value of all covered products imported from the manufacturer or producer in a calendar year.
The quantity of all covered products imported from the manufacturer or producer in a calendar year.
The frequency of importation from the manufacturer or producer in a calendar year.

subsection.header: Registry of agents of foreign manufacturers and certifications

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Commerce shall, in cooperation with each head of an applicable agency, establish and keep up to date a registry of agents registered under subsection (a), certifications submitted under section 2(5)(B), and certifications removed pursuant to subsection (e).
The Secretary of Commerce shall make the registry established under paragraph (1) available—

subparagraph.text: to the Commissioner responsible for U.S. Customs and Border Protection in a format prescribed by the Commissioner.

paragraph.text: A foreign manufacturer or producer of a covered product that registers an agent under this section thereby consents to the personal jurisdiction of the State and Federal courts of the State in which the registered agent is located for the purpose of any judicial proceeding related to such covered product.
Paragraph (1) shall not apply to actions brought by foreign plaintiffs where the alleged injury or damage occurred outside the United States.

Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Commerce, the Commissioner responsible for U.S. Customs and Border Protection, and each head of an applicable agency shall prescribe regulations to carry out this section.
The Secretary of Commerce, the Commissioner responsible for U.S. Customs and Border Protection, and each head of an applicable agency shall cooperate and consult with one another for the purpose of—

subparagraph.text: prescribing consistent regulations to the extent necessary for the effective and efficient sharing of information and establishment of systems and procedures necessary to carry out this section; and
establishing minimum requirements described in subsection (a)(4), and to the extent advisable and practicable for the purpose of establishing consistent minimum requirements.

subsection.text: Upon actual knowledge or verified information that any person to whom the requirements of section 2(5)(B) applies has failed to fulfill such requirements the applicable agency shall—

paragraph.text: notify the Secretary of Commerce that the certification of such person must be removed from the registry under section 3(b); and
notify such person that the related foreign manufacturer or producer must comply with section 3.

section.header: Prohibition of importation of products of manufacturers without registered agents in United States

subsection.text: Beginning on the date that is 180 days after the date the regulations required under section 3(d) are prescribed, a person may not import into the United States a covered product (or component part that will be used in the United States to manufacture a covered product) if such product (or component part) or any part of such product (or component part) was manufactured or produced outside the United States by a manufacturer or producer who does not have a registered agent described in section 3(a) whose authority is in effect on the date of the importation.
The Secretary of Homeland Security shall prescribe regulations to enforce the prohibition in subsection (a).

section.header: Reporting of defects in covered products in foreign countries

subsection.text: Not later than 5 working days after determining to conduct a safety recall or other safety campaign in a foreign country of a covered product that is identical or substantially similar to a covered product offered for sale in the United States, the manufacturer or producer of the covered product shall report the determination to the head of the applicable agency.

Not later than 5 working days after receiving notification that the government of a foreign country has determined that a safety recall or other safety campaign must be conducted in the foreign country of a covered product that is identical or substantially similar to a covered product offered for sale in the United States, the manufacturer or producer of the covered product shall report the determination to the head of the applicable agency.
Not later than the date described in subsection (d), the head of each applicable agency shall prescribe the contents of the notification required by this section.
Except as provided in subsection (c), this section shall take effect on the date that is one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Study on registration of agents of foreign food producers authorized to accept service of process in the United States
section.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture and the Commissioner of Food and Drugs shall jointly—

paragraph.text: complete a study on the feasibility and advisability of requiring foreign producers of food distributed in commerce to register an agent in the United States who is authorized to accept service of process on behalf of such producers for the purpose of any State or Federal regulatory proceeding or any civil action in State or Federal court related to such food products; and
submit to Congress a report on the findings of the Secretary with respect to such study.

section.header: Study on registration of agents of foreign manufacturers and producers of component parts within covered products
section.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the head of each applicable agency shall—

paragraph.text: complete a study on determining feasible and advisable methods of requiring manufacturers or producers of component parts within covered products manufactured or produced outside the United States and distributed in commerce to register agents in the United States who are authorized to accept service of process on behalf of such manufacturers or producers for the purpose of any State or Federal regulatory proceeding or any civil action in State or Federal court related to such component parts; and
submit to Congress a report on the findings of the head of the applicable agency with respect to the study.

section.header: Study on enforcement of United States judgments relating to defective drywall imported from China
section.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall—

paragraph.text: complete a study on methods to enforce judgments of any State or Federal regulatory proceeding or any civil action in State or Federal court relating to defective drywall imported from the People’s Republic of China and distributed in commerce during the period 2004 through 2007 and used in residential dwellings in the United States; and
submit to Congress a report on the findings of the Comptroller General with respect to the study.

section.text: Nothing in this Act shall affect the authority of any State to establish or continue in effect a provision of State law relating to service of process or personal jurisdiction, except to the extent that such provision of law is inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, and then only to the extent of such inconsistency.
